problem_text:
Characters φ and ψ of a finite group G are said to be semiproportional if they are not proportional and there is a normal subset M of G such that φ|M is proportional to ψ|M and φ|G\M is proportional to ψ|G\M.
Conjecture: If φ and ψ are semiproportional irreducible characters of a finite group, then φ(1) = ψ(1).
V. A. Belonogov
